acp.store

Class DataStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • acp.store.DataStore

  • public class DataStore
extends java.lang.Object
    DataStore is utilize as the Data layer component to handle operation that communicates with Database. It is designed in a way that the methods doing simple and reusable task.
    Author:
    Teo Kee Cheng

      • searchText

        public java.util.List<Suggestion> searchText(java.lang.String userInput,
                                    Preference prefs,
                                    boolean autoTrigger)
        Search a list of relevant suggestions by user input and user preferences.
        Parameters:
        userInput - search string input from the user.
        prefs - user preferences of ACP.
        Returns:
        non-empty List object if result exist and is according to the preferences (Threshold setting), empty List object if result does not exist or is not according to the preferences (Threshold setting).

      • searchEntity

        public java.util.List<Suggestion> searchEntity(java.lang.String userInput,
                                      Preference prefs,
                                      boolean autoTrigger)
        Search a list of relevant entities by user input and user preferences.
        Parameters:
        userInput - search string input from the user.
        prefs - user preferences of ACP.
        Returns:
        non-empty List object if result exist and is according to the preferences (Threshold setting), empty List object if result does not exist or is not according to the preferences (Threshold setting).

      • startSession

        public void startSession()
        Start a session with Hibernate. Allows retrieval of data but not manipulation of data.

      • getSession

        public org.hibernate.Session getSession()
        Get the current session.
        Returns:
        the current session.

      • closeSession

        public void closeSession()
        Close the session with Hibernate.

      • startTransaction

        public void startTransaction()
        Start a transaction with Hibernate. Allows retrieval of data and manipulation of data.

      • commitTransaction

        public void commitTransaction()
        Commit changes through Hibernate. All changes made will be updated.

      • rollbackTransaction

        public void rollbackTransaction()
        Rollback a transaction with Hibernate. All changes made will be undo.
